content.text: Backend development is like the behind-the-scenes work of a website. It's everything that happens when you do things like log in or search for something. You don’t see it, but it makes sure everything works properly.
content.additional_text: Think of it as the part of a restaurant that cooks and prepares the food, while the front of the restaurant is where customers enjoy their meals.

content.text: Backend development is important because it handles all the tasks that users don’t see. It makes sure things like logging in and saving data work smoothly.

quiz.question: What does backend development do?
options: It handles user requests and data
quiz.answer: It handles user requests and data

content.text: Here are the main parts that help backend development work:

list.title: Servers
list.text: Servers are computers that store and process information. They help send the right data back to users when they make requests.

list.title: Databases
list.text: Databases are like big storage rooms that keep all the important information, such as user accounts and messages.

list.title: Server-side Languages
list.text: These are languages like JavaScript, Python, or PHP that help the server understand what to do.

list.title: APIs
list.text: APIs are like messengers. They help the frontend (the visible part of a website) talk to the backend (the hidden part).

content.text: There are different languages used for backend programming. Here are some easy ones:

list.title: Node.js
list.text: Node.js uses JavaScript on the server side. It's fast and popular for building websites.

list.title: Python
list.text: Python is easy to read and write. Many developers like it for its simplicity.

list.title: PHP
list.text: PHP is often used for websites like WordPress. It's good for handling web pages.

quiz.question: Which language is easy to read and often used in backend development?

content.text: Databases store all kinds of information. There are two main types:

list.title: SQL Databases
list.text: SQL databases organize data in tables, like a spreadsheet. They are great for structured information.

list.title: NoSQL Databases
list.text: NoSQL databases store data in a flexible way, making them good for different types of data.

content.additional_text: Think of SQL like a filing cabinet with neatly organized files, and NoSQL like a box where you keep all kinds of things together.

content.text: APIs are tools that let different parts of a website talk to each other. They help the frontend get data from the backend.
content.additional_text: For example, when you want to see your profile, the frontend asks the API, and the API gets the data from the backend.

content.text: User authentication is the process of checking who you are when you log in. The backend makes sure your information is safe.
content.additional_text: When you enter your username and password, the backend checks if they are correct before letting you in.

content.text: Backend development must keep user data safe. This means using techniques to protect information from hackers.
content.additional_text: For example, passwords should be hidden and encrypted so no one else can read them.

content.text: The frontend (what you see) and backend (what you don’t see) work together. When you click a button, the frontend asks the backend to do something.

quiz.question: How do the frontend and backend communicate?

content.text: Backend development is essential for making websites function properly. It ensures that all the behind-the-scenes work happens seamlessly, allowing users to have a good experience.
